intro: Byrsonima berteroana, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or araçá-do-cerrado, is a shrub or small tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red when ripe, containing several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils in forested or open areas.
